Rae Vena presents : "Inspire Love" Live art tour 2017 
An Intimate exhibit of surreal  and live art!
 
My greatest success over the years has been sharing the gift of inspiration with others. Recent revelations have aided me to highlight this important intention for my 2017 festival tour. If I could carry only one message through my art it would be this simple but powerful verse:  â€œInspire Loveâ€  To your Neighbor, your friend, your son your daughter , the stranger you shared a smile with!  We all seek and aspire towards a positive epiphany at this particular cross road.     Through live art, self expression is a well loved journey both inwards and outwards!  Ineffable benefits are abound for the artist and beholder! What improv painting unfolds on my canvas further reflects another facet of my inner self.. Perhaps even a cue to the next path on my vision quest.   My past esteemed artworks have held upmost detail to a ethereal theme, and through this artistic style I envision my further transcendence in art.  Baby blue, pink and mint, a splash of black white, rainbow.. 8 years experience, and with each year passing my talent progresses; the best is only yet to come! I am more than excited to offer for 2017 â€œInspire Loveâ€  Live art by Rae Vena  
 Otherworldly, at first glance, a jumbo flower hangs down, art nestled between its petals.. A round canopy hangs from above, each pastel petal flows gently in the wind revealing its inner artful purpose. Inside, a nest of rugs & pillows surround an intimate exhibit of surreal art . In the center a blossoming live art painting takes host ! My art environment is part installation, part performance -for this is where my live art magic will take home for the weekend. By nightfall the glimmer of lights further invite observers to explore the art locus. Eclipsed by day, luminescent night sky will glow with curiosity on the inside floret. A live art hub,  where you can meet the artist, see the process and of course share space with others in creative conversation. This project is designed & will be handmade using as many up-cycled materials as possible. The top of the canopy is pvc tubing attached to roped pulley system. Pastel fabrics will be cut & sewn into the petals, then fitted with a bottom casing for water resistance. This canopy is decorative as well as useful for protection against rain, or simply roping off the art & displaying a "closed" sign during off hours for dancing! The essential benefit of hosting a space throughout the weekend is that guests can periodically visit to see an ongoing live art exhibit. Plans include fabricating a lock box for paints & tools of my trade & create a secure free standing wall from repurposed materials. If my timeline and costs doesn't permit the build of these extra elements, a heavy based easel will be secured  & a patio umbrella used as a base for my live painting. My installation is best suited under a tree to easily hang the canopy from above, if necessary a free standing method can be implemented with the patio base. I suggest distance of 30 meters or less to available electricity, and placement within earshot of a stage for musical inspiration! Thank you for joining me in celebrating my dedication in creation, for this unique festival exhibit  ~ Inspire Love , Blessed Coast 2017!
rates: I ask that my ticket, parking and camping to be covered. And any vendor fee waived if art sale arises.   If available I ask meal tickets or meal plan provided for my weekend performance and art installation.
comments:
I apologize if this application is specifically for Music offerings !

My installation is best suited under a tree to easily hang the canopy from above, I suggest distance of 30 meters or less to available electricity.
I require an outlet of electricity to light 2 LED Bulbs for art in the evening.
2 x 2 x 3 meters high.

The LightWalkers are a Ceremonial Prayerformance collaboration between Phoenix Muranetz and Devaya Corbett. Based in the beautiful Westcoast of Canada, these two light walkers embody the art of sacred performance, energy healing, as well as providing a container for those who are seeking a safe space within the festival environment. Our performance style has been described as a fusion of sacred medicine ceremony with the tribal wisdom of our ancestral lineage. We seek to raise the vibrational output within the festival circle so that each attendee we are in union with is able to receive the totality of inner liberation through a sacred and powerful interaction with one another. 

INTENTION
We would love to perform before an opening act DJ or Musician with a short 5-10 min Prayerformance, honouring the land, the ancestors and Great Spirit. bio:
Let go of time and space to arrive in the moment, as you join Astaria Light for a sacred journey into the heart of your soul. 

Facilitated by the sound vibrations and harmonic melodies of the piano, flute, crystal bowls, medicine drums, chimes, and many more, you will float along the sacred sound current back home to your self. Your soul will also be serenaded by the light frequencies Astaria channels through her voice. Your cells will be harmonized, DNA activated, and awareness awakened as you gain clarity, inner peace, and a heart-high.

Astaria is a multi-instrumentalist, a soul singer, and a carrier of light for this world. She is a certified Sound Healing Practitioner, Reiki Master, Shamanic Medicine Practitioner, and trained Counsellor. In addition to creating community gatherings, she also offers private sound therapy sessions to hold space for clients who wish to explore their soulâ€™s mission, release self-limiting patterns, and find their way back home to their truth. 

â€”â€”

Expect the unexpected when participating in one of Astariaâ€™s sound journeys. She will envelop your being with various sounds and melodies channeled through her voice, as well as the harmonizing vibrations produced by an array of instruments. Each instrument carries itâ€™s own song, spirit, and vibration, offering a different experience of self when heard. Listen and choose your own adventure as you close your eyes and journey along the sound current, navigating the depths of your soul, and connecting with higher vibrational realms. Remember who you are and where you come from when you hear the ancient sounds of your origins. 

â€”â€”
comments:
I work with a variety of instruments and will need a cord to connect my piano keyboard to the amplification system and power.  In smaller settings I play acoustically, in a larger setting I will need two mics (with stands and cords) for amplifying the sound of my crystal bowls and steel tongue drum. I have a vocal mic I can bring, otherwise, I will need a 3rd mic provided for my voice. I enjoy the effect of reverb added to the sound. ;)

My sound journey would best be experienced to either open or close an evening. To open, I would start with a meditation to bring everyone into a high vibe resonant state, primed to receive the musical expressions shared thereafter. 
To close the evening, I would intend to bring everyone into a grounded state, connected with each other and their temple bodies, to seal the energy received prior, and to send everyone off into a blissful state for the rest of their night.  
<3

Thank you so much for your consideration in providing a space for me to offer my sound at Blessed Coast Festival. I participated last year in the Healing Hut, sharing private sound sessions by donation, alongside a group of other wonderful healers. I feel strongly that my sound expression will be better received this year in a group setting, where our community will gather and collectively raise our vibration in the weave of the sound tapestry that I will create.
I am soooo excited to participate and share my unique expression with this magical community that comes together for Blessed Coast. 

Thank you for all that you do to create such a beautiful high vibe festival. <3 xo

bio:
Gamma Ra offers a range of unique and captivating performances specializing in sultry fire dance. With an array of different props and mystical costuming, Gamma Ra conjures an otherworldly experience intended to free the audience from their reigns of reality. Using the forces of nature in combination with skill from years of dedication to the circus arts, Gamma Ra creates an act filled with exhilaration, sensuality, and awe. Gamma Ra connects with her audience using her entrancing stage presence and takes them on a beautiful journey through her flow, tapping into the ancient and primitive energy of the Goddess. 

For Blessed Coast, I would love to offer a fire dance performance (including acts such as fans, dragon staff, fire eating/fleshing, palm torches, hoop). This could be an act on it's own, or coupled side-stage to a musical act. I would also love to perform a side-stage silk fan act, and do some character roving on the festival grounds to bring just a little more magic to the already fantastical Blessed Coast.

I run several regular ecstatic dances in Boston, Western Mass, and NYC as well as DJ at ecstatic dances and festivals around the world.  I would love to offer a rich wave of dance music to take festivalers through a wave of energetic movement and full expression!

bio: Hi. I'm an interdisciplinary artist from Vancouver, a singer-songwriter and visual artist who plays acoustic and electric guitar. My last release was called 'Light Pollution' and all the songs had to do with different kinds of light, meteor showers, refracted light, and how sometimes darker places can bring more clarity about what we value. My debut album (June 2018) is called 'Howl' and is themed around a call to reconnect to a de-domesticated wilderness, within and without, and how we need the tonic of wildness. It would be amazing to share the songs from these albums with Blessed Coast, as the stories they tell may bring some meaningful moments of helping people connect to the atmosphere and environment where the festival is situated.
Spirit-based singer-songwriter channeling the teachings of Ram Dass, Wayne Dyer,  Yogananda in powerful songs and chants.

bio:
Bloom is an Earth Activist musician and new paradigm pollinator. With his guitar and voice, backed up with percussion, violin, cello, and supporting vocals, Bloom creates interactive performances that imbue audiences with a revived active hope for a thriving, vibrant, harmonious, regenerative world. 

Bloom was born from the warm coastal womb of central California in San Luis Obispo, educated by the fairies and tree people at the University of California Santa Cruz with a degree in Psychology and Cognitive Science, (and a special focus on life, the universe and everything,) and initiated into the intergalactic tribe of awakening beings during his six months of travel through Central America, becoming initiated into the modern day mystery school via volunteering at an endless stream of transformational festivals. He then went on a spiritual pilgrimage through Peru and Bolivia, emerging with a strengthened sense of life path and purpose, re-visited Costa Rica, and is now on Vancouver Island in Canada for his Permaculture Design Course/Earth Activist Training with Starhawk and friends. He is a co-founder, co-organizer, and co-creator of the "Blooming Biodiversity" permaculture tour (www.BloomingBiodiversity.org), which in the Fall of 2015, toured the North American West Coast with a team called â€œSolutionary Productions." It was a journey of healing the world through holistic integrative permaculture activations worldwide. The tour has taken him to Hawaii, to Peru, where he was planting gardens and working with Shipibo children through the Arkana Alliance organization, on to Bali, Australia, and New Zealand, and currently back to the North American West Coast.
rates: 2 Festival Tickets & if possible, covering flight from Portland + food
comments:
All we need is a guitar amp, two microphones, and a drum mic for cajon! 

We can also perform as Blooming Anahata, which is the music of myself and Anahata (Anna Combi) combined! We are happy to play multiple sets, and lead song-writing workshops! 

We love you Blessed Coast fam!

My name is Philip Auer and I am a passionate and ambitious up-and-coming musician who is interested in playing at your festival for 2017! I'll start off by telling you a little bit about my musical journey. 

I started playing classical piano from a young age and eventually fell in love with the instrument. I was then pulled into improvisation and jazz, and soon enough I began composing electronic bass music. I am now dedicating all my energy towards a music career and have just begun a jazz piano degree at Grant Macewan University. My vision is to combine the powerful sounds of electronic music with live piano into a combination which elates the dance-floor and inspires humanity.

Over the last year, I have made many moves to advance my career. I released my first album titled 'The Vault' on December 2015, and have since released an EP titled 'Primal Waking' which features my best music yet (https://soundcloud.com/pauermusic/sets/primal-waking-ep). I played for the closing ceremonies at Astral Harvest last summer, so I have experience playing at festivals (link: music starts at 05:30 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L_FLB4or938&t=564s). I am a competent pianist and am constantly practicing to become the most well-rounded musician I can be (you can check out my instagram for piano clips: https://www.instagram.com/pauermusic).

My music could be described as deep rhythmic bass mid-tempo with strong chord progressions and ethereal soundscapes. The set I would throw at your festival would have 'thick midtempo vibes' most likely suited for night-time. Like I said, I am currently dedicating all of my energy towards becoming the best musician I can be, and I genuinely believe that my performance would bring something really special to this festival.
comments: I would feel very blessed for the opportunity to share the fruits of my artistic labor at this festival.

Three-part harmonies & hypnotic melodies raise the collective vibration while audiences dance, sing, meditate and bliss out!

Check out our new album "Remember Your True Name" on Spotify.  
Thank you for considering OmTara!  Sat Nam!

comments: We both live on 5 acres up in the foothills of Oregon, working with the land and cultivating our different crafts. Our set really reflects our passion for living harmoniously with one another and keeping the global rhythm going! I hope we can make some magic happen this year!

bio: We would love to give the crowd at your festival a chance to dance to our unique brand of music.  We are influenced by Dub and Dancehall Reggae, and are community-minded about developing our music. Our live set flexes from pure acoustic to live electronic music with heavy bass, big harmonies, and eclectic sample work.

We really love to perform and have a cool new set and are releasing a new mixtape this spring. If we have enough notice we can string together shows around this festival and cover costs that way.  So our price is negotiable.

bio: Whether as a one-piece Soul-Roots storyteller, or a funky Dancehall trio, Soulstice Creation blends soul-warming grooves with conscious, elevating lyricism to serve and better the world at large.
rates: As a solo act (acoustic guitar/vocals): $100 for up to 45 minutes + travel (1 tank of gas from Vernon BC ~$50) = $150 + Trio: +$50/member = $250
comments:
From my first encounter with the idea of Blessed Coast (on a blissful ferry ride back from Atmosphere Gathering 2015) I have dreamed of adding the intentions of Soulstice Creation to your wellspring of joy and positive energy. This music is meant to inspire and awaken those people who are willing to be inspired and awakened. And I can think of no better group than the community of loving, supportive, and receptive souls at Blessed Coast.

The rates stated above are as flexible as possible, as Soulstice Creation can be performed in a stripped down solo style. In the event of a solo performance, the rate can be further negotiated as overhead costs are substantially reduced (and I truly believe this music has arole to play at Blessed Coast).

I am incredibly grateful to you for all the loving effort put into this gathering.
So much joy and love to you!
Tristan Charbonneau of Soulstice Creation

bio: An electro-acoustic fusion of South American shamanic melodies, Afro-Latin rhythms and banging beats, IEMANJO is medicine music for the 21st century.  Singer and multi-instrumentalist Ben Harris brings a deep understanding of both the genres and the intention and traditions behind them, spinning the sonic universe of Latin America into something completely his own.  2017 has started with major festival dates at Cosmic Convergence (Guatemala), Wanderlust (US and Canada) and Bali Spirit Festival.  A follow-up full length to 2015's debut "Medicina" (featuring collaborations with Thornato, Srikalogy, Scott Nice, and more) is on the way as well.  As a live performance, IEMANJO is a high energy, danceable show featuring Harris playing the trumpet and 8-string ukulele and singing in three languages combined with DJ beat science.
comments:
I also carry cacao from Guatemala and have offered cacao ceremony at festivals and private events over the past two years.  These can be combined with a live or DJ'd ecstatic dance set.  
https://www.bencliftonharris.com/cacao

bio:
I grew up listening to and singing traditional mantra, bhajan/kirtan, and classical ragas in Canada and India in a spiritual family. 

I initially sang spiritual Indian songs rooted in the temple traditions of bhajans, kirtan and other devotional music, but also studied and performed formal music in piano and violin, voice, harmonium, and some Indian percussion. I have worked on both Western and Indian vocals with local and international teachers. Most recently I started earning Dhrupad (yoga of sound), a meditative and the most ancient style of spiritual singing with Ramakant Gundecha.

(spanish site www.cwantamusicaindia.com)
comments:
I am able to offer a variety of options: 

1) Solo performance with classical ragas for the specific time of day with tanpura, and bhajan/kirtan and mantra in traditional melodies with harmonium. It could be straight singing or a mix of stort telling. (20 minutes - 45 minutes)

2) A group performance with a tabla player and chorus singer (this would cost more to pay for the other members). (30-45 minutes)

3) I could provide a workshop on Kirtan and Mantra 101 to present the history of mantra and kirtan, how it evolved and of course sing a few. (1-1.5 hours)

4) In-depth practice of specific mantra and/or kirtan. Learn the proper pronunciation and melodies as well as the stories and uses of the mantra and/or kirtan. (1-1.5 hours)

*I will have to bring my kids with me (age 4 and 1 by then)

bio: As two distinct but complementary conduits of cosmic song, Erothyme and Little Star are united by sharing a prayerful reverence toward the music they bring into this world. Erothyme produces spacious bass-infused downtempo, using a combination of digital synthesis and recorded sounds from nature. Little Star weaves multidimensional hymns through live vocal looping. In their collaborative performance, live-looped vocals and keyboard melodies dance upon a foundation of heartfully crafted beats and celestial soundscapes, merging the pristine intricacy of well-produced electronic music with the spontaneity and organic warmth of live instrumentation. Their music invokes a sense of the mythic and timeless, revealing the deeper harmony that exists between seemingly separate mediums.
rates: $500 for (1) Erothyme & Little Star collaborative set, OR, as a package deal, $700 for (1) Erothyme & Little Star set + (1) Erothyme set + (1) Little Star set (3 total performances!)
comments:
Individual applications for Erothyme and Little Star forthcoming~
Stay Blessed!

bio:
Organic electronic music with diverse influences, multi-genre, multi-tempo, multi-emotion, all the way from ambient to downtempo to psy-funk to glitch-laced drumnbass, often featuring sounds sourced from nature, performed with live synth improvisation and sometimes talkbox. Heady, but also groovy. Deep, but also playful. Adaptable, for dancefloors, or for ceremonies, or for chillout spaces, or for sunrises. This project is musical world I've cultivated for more than a decade and it is still constantly branching out into new terrain!

bio:
Annie Sea brings both a fierce passion and gentle flow to her music. She sings anthems to inspire awakening with a voice that evokes the smooth power of the ocean. Her acoustic soul style blends jazzy hip-hop with folk-pop by live looping percussion, vocals, ukulele, guitar, and the occasional glockenspiel. She is moved to create socially conscious art, songs of catharsis, and songs of renewal. 

Based in the Green Dream tiny house in Portland, Oregon, Annie has shared her music throughout California, Washington, Alaska, and Hawaii. Her original music has been featured on 88.5 KMUZ in Oregon and the The Film Vault podcast.

I would be honored to share my music anywhere you see fit. I have a battery powered amp and looper set up, so I can easily play at an off-grid or smaller acoustic stage. I am also happy to help with sound at any of the stages. 
Peace and Blessings!
Annie

bio:
Hey! I am a Yogini and Yoga Teacher with many practices I'd love to share at this beautiful festival! I can offer a variety of yoga sessions as listed below, let me know which ones you are interested in!

Yin Yoga Sessions - 
One of the styles of yoga I teach and love is yin yoga Yin Yoga is a deeply meditative practice where poses are held for 3 - 5 minutes each in order to begin release of connective tissue I teach classes that focus on certain Meridians in the Chinese Medicine system which correspond to certain elements and organs Each one focuses on a different organ for example the Water Element class focuses on the Kidneys, Wood Element focuses on Liver, ect ect 
The classes are about an hour long and are juicy done in the evening by candlelight But they are lovely anytime of day! These classes can be a really sweet contribution to the festival vibe as they are deeply relaxing and give people an opportunity to come into harmony with themselves and the elements, while having a profound detoxifying effect on the organs

Cakra System Yoga Sessions
I also teach classes centered around the Cakra System These classes focus on different pranayama breathing exercises as well as kriyas energetic cleansing, mudras, and some physical movements and visualizations that charge up the different Cakras I either teach one class which starts at the root cakra and works its way up the Cakras to the top of the head, or I teach different classes which focus specifically on one Cakra the entire time These sessions often leave people feeling energized, clear, and connected to their spirits

Hatha and Vinyasa Flow Sessions -
I also love to teach Hatha flow and Vinyasa flow classes I weave mudras, pranayama and kriyas together with physical classes that range from vigorous Power Vinyasa to mellow Hatha flow These can be nice classes to do early in the day, to get people charged up for the rest of the festival

This is what I am willing to offer, any or all of it, depending on what the festival is interested in incorporating! If I can contribute any of those things above, let me know  

I'm happy to exchange these classes for a festival pass, but depending on the resources of the festival, if it's possible for me to receive payment, as a practicing yoga instructor of course I would apriciate that

Blessings!
Jah Love!
Lucy

bio:
I am a Vancouver based yoga teacher, trained by Emerson Lim at Karma Teachers Through my training there I developed a teaching style devoted to karma yoga and as such am committed to sharing my practice freely for the benefits of others and as an act of service first 

I would be interested in offering one or both of the following: 1 Z- a slow, meditative yoga class for deep relaxation and shining, open heart, 2 Yoga and Meditation for Dancing- an inverse yoga class, developed by myself, that leads the student from meditation into sustained seated postures, moving into energizing standing postures to activate the student for the dance floor Ideally held before the music starts for the day/evening

Nawt-sa-maat Yoga: 
Nawt-sa-maat is a Coast Salish word meaning "One house, one heart, one prayer"; this 2 hr journey incorporates asana poses, pranayama breath work, meditation, and song to reveal existing parallels between yogic traditions and the indigenous philosophies of Turtle Island Nawt-sa-maat Yoga introduces Medicine Wheel wisdom and Seven Directions teachings through a yoga practice that is accessible for brand new and life-long students alike By weaving together distinct yet mutually complimentary Indigenous and Yogic perspectives into a holistic practice aimed toward personal enlightenment and Oneness, participants gain skills to foster healthy relationships with themselves and their families, build community, and walk ever more gently together on the planet we all call home
rates: The cost of a festival pass, and travel expenses if possible I'm open to co-creating a karmic exchange with Festival orgs

bio:
A Didjeridu Sound Journey will delve our spirits into an expansive musical meditation with live Didjeridu vibrations played over the body to release any stuck or stagnant energy being held in one's system

Come Relax into a Full Body Vibrational Experience through the use of an Australian Didjeridu, A Buthang Steel Tongue Drum, Tibetan and Crystal Singing Bowls, Chimes, a Bull Roarer and a Mystical remix to add to the top

The use of an Authentic Australian Didjeridu allows for the deep energies of ancient ancestors to be called upon for these healing journeys

Tanya carries Wise Words, and intuitive healings and is open to sharing safe space to release and further explore your peaceful tribal warriorï¿½ï¿½

I would like to offer my music to any other class who would like to have the accompaniment of sound Blessings

wwwdevinedidjeriducom

5Rhythms Dance and Movement Meditation


The 5Rhythms are a form of ecstatic dance, a workout for body and soul, a moving meditation and a spiritual practice While the practice itself is simple, it has the power to catalyze deep healing and creative
expression Dancing the 5 Rhythms can be meditative, expressive, fun and transformative It gives us the opportunity to find freedom in motion, states of heightened awareness, profound healing and the inspiration for living a creative and fulfilling life

We will practice opening ourselves to our relationship with the earth, finding our roots and our ability to be grounded, centered and
present in the here and now From that place the dance invites us to dive deep into our souls to connect with our uniqueness Then we can spread our wings and share our gifts effortlessly with each other Our dance becomes an offering

Bettina Rothe is a facilitator of conscious movement practices and community building whose passion is to ignite one's connection with self, to others and to the continuum of all life

Her work is grounded in holistic, somatic based modalities with a strong focus on the 5Rhythmsï¿½, mindfulness practices and embodied leadership principles Bettina's teaching style is inviting, inspiring and supportive In her work she balances spiritual elements with practicality, humour and a deep knowledge of human behaviour She lives in Vancouver, BC and offers workshops in North America and Europe

 wwwbettinarothecom

bio:
Story is My Yoga

Would love to lead an interactive workshop on transformational storytelling With experiential exercises and group discussion Rooted in the philosophy of yoga and the wisdom of transformation Exploring together a new vocabulary for sharing the inherent gifts in all of us

This is a workshop for anyone in the business of transformation - especially coaches, change-agents, and creatives Who want to more authentically build their platform of influence 

You see the future, full of exciting possibilities You're already making a difference in people's lives You just wish more folks understood the mojo of who you are, what you do, and how you roll 

This is a workshop on how to story yourself into being 

We'll explore your story of origin, and discover the untapped power of your story All based on the principles that character trumps credentials and presence trumps performance Storytelling is like fortune-telling Are you choosing the right story for the future you want to create?

Yoga is about the resolution of opposites About union and connection to source Storytelling is one of the deepest forms of yoga A way to access your inner-most knowing And express it to the world in a way that awakens the heart, resolves conflict, and makes things whole 

You already are a storyteller We all are Question is, do you know the stories you inhabit? Are you telling the right stories for the future you want to create? How do you get others to see what you see? 

Story is a verb That's where the magic of story resides In the conjugation of your life's experiences into wisdom Where you recognize the inherent choice in every moment to define the meaning and path forward When you change, the story has to change Because the stories you tell literally make the world 

Michael Margolis is a teacher, author, and entrepreneur He's the founder of Get Storied, the world's leading school for business storytelling He's also a healer and story shaman, trained in the science of subtle body awareness and the anatomy of the soul Michael is left-handed, color-blind, and eats more chocolate than the average human wwwgetstoriedcom

I created Koi Chi Healing for all the services I offer, and for this festival I was hoping to offer one of my workshops

Depending on what your festival needs I have a couple of workshops I'd really like to share with others I have spoken to Kala about my circumstance of dates I will not be able to attend till the 22nd of the festival, and hope what I can offer will be helpful :


THE ART OF PERCEPTION EXPRESSION
This is a 3 hr creative expression/perception expansion workshop! Art supplies will be provided AND you get to take home your creations : will need to have a cap on how many people, preferably around 10-20, can attend as I'll need to get the right number of canvases for people to paint/use/take home

"This creative workshop are for those who simply want to express in a judgement-free way through art, all the while gaining new insights and perceptions on creative expression Often people feel that creativity is reserved for the arts, let me tell you it is absolutely not! : I think it is imperative to remember that the word creativity stems from the root word, ï¿½ï¿½Createï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ so a scientist who isnï¿½ï¿½t artistic, is creative when they create a new theory; or a mechanic is creative when they build a motor-run bicycle We are always creating in life So donï¿½ï¿½t be afraid to create whatever you imagine, this is what this space and workshop is for, to gain a new perspective on creative expression"

I created this workshop after my own plant medicine journey with mushrooms & painting and learned so much about the way we perceive expression, communicate our expression, limit our expression and most significantly - how our expression creates perceptions And so I want to share what I've learned, and hope that they too will leave with a new perception about expression It will be 3 hours of laughter, smiles, heart connections, new perspectives, full expressions and authentic selves

We will start with introductions as well as our intentions guided by an oracle card draw and an explanation on the purpose of this creative expression workshop, then we will spend a full hour creating freely through paint & mix-media and music I will go around and aid in bringing into consciousness the choices they are making with art, then the final hour will be for sharing and discussion on the different perspectives we receive from other's creations - then the creator will share their original intention

All that you need to bring with you are clothing that can get paint on it as youï¿½ï¿½ll be painting/creating with hands, and come with a positive attitude, open heart & mind

The cost per person is $3000 original is $50, but with no tea/snacks - $30 This is negotiable as well though for your festival - this will cover the art supplies used as well as the one you take with you

_____________________________________

HEART EXPANSION: I AM TO WE ARE
This is a 15-2hr workshop - there does not have to be a charge for this workshop I would prefer to keep it down to a size of 10-14 people

It is based on the practice of Ho'oponopono, while understanding what oneness feels like on a very intimate and personal level

The purpose of this workshop is to break through the mental understanding/limitations of oneness - to not just simply say "Namaste," "We are one," "I see you in me," etc without truly understanding how it feels to move from the "I AM" to "WE ARE" To bring this New Earth of wholeness & oneness into reality, the oneness must be tangible to our hearts and body as well

So we begin with an introduction/sharing circle of why we have wanted to participate and what we feel like oneness meansï¿½ï¿½; I will also speak briefly of seeing oneness in everythingï¿½ï¿½ Then we will do a short guided meditation, to centre us and open our hearts to the journey we are about to embark on Then we will sit across another person we've never met before and move through the practice of Ho'oponopono "Goodbye, I'm sorry - Please forgive me, Thank you, I love You"ï¿½ï¿½ After we will share again how our experiences were Rounding off with a group hug/circle where we place one hand on our hearts and one on the person's heart to the right of us Then end with a OM and Namaste!ï¿½ï¿½

If you are short in healing practitioners I can also offer my Crystal Healing and/or Shamballa Reiki as well :
_____________

I hope that these options will fit with your festival! It would be great to also know what the processes is for the teachers if they are doing it in exchange for a ticket Ie how long, how many times, meals? etc 

Thank you!
Jocelyn Lee

This is a up on your feet super interactive workshop where we connect with one another and our authentic playful self 

Through a serious of fun improv games, movement exercises, and connection meditations we move and express our bodies to find our authentic selves Often time in our daily lives we are forced to behave and act how society wants us to, "normal" w/e that is :P

Fear or standing out, looking goofy, not getting it "right", these ideas hold us back from truly owning who we are and all aspects of ourselves 

In this workshop we leave all that behind and learn how to be in the moment, fearlessly, and radiant our true inner awesomeness

In this workshop we will find our 4 main personal spirit animals and we will personify them through movement, sounds, music, drawings, body painting and acting The workshop has elements of Butho dancing, Southamerican shamanism, tribal dancing, musical improvisation and guided visualizations      We will start the journey with a small introduction into Totemism and different indigenous traditions around dance, music and ceremonies Later we will find our spirit animal or plant spirit through dance improvisations, a guided & collaborative sound journey and tribal body painting

Hello beautiful people!
8 years ago I graduated from the University of Alberta with a degree in honors genetics  At the time I was expected to begin medical school, but I was disillusioned and upset at the little attention that was paid to what we call the placebo  Furthermore, it was difficult to see how any real evidence could be found when the modern medical establishment knows so little about consciousness itself  During my last couple years of my 5 year degree, I could only find a few researchers who were genuinely tackling the problem, and found my higher level genetics professors stumped when I asked questions that reached into the holes at the foundations of modern biology and medical research  There are so many anomalies simply being ignored because they do not fit into the current medical paradigm of reality  These anomalies cause discomfort within the minds of these researchers and doctors, who choose to ignore the science and continue on as though nothing happened, but science is about the pursuit of truth no matter where it takes you
The last 8 years have led me to every corner of the planet to study with Yogis, Monks, Shamans of the amazon, and to unique and cutting edge research labs all over the States, Canada, and Europe  What I found is a growing body of evidence to show how powerful our minds are when it comes to the manifestation of a strong healthy body, and an increasing number of researchers tackling the question of the placebo in honest, open minded ways  What I also discovered was the huge body of evidence uncovered by physicists over the last 100 years  None of it was taught in any biology classes, which is why modern medical research hasn't the slightest clue about what consciousness really might be  These physicists were never looking for answers to the consciousness riddle, they were trying to uncover the basic workings of the universe, but as a by-product of their curiosity, they have shown us an incredible amount concerning the question of consciousness  Finally a couple years ago, the BBC documentary 'What is Reality' was the first mainstream documentary to attempt to explain to us that it is impossible to understand reality without understanding the role consciousness plays in its creation, and that you are now an outsider in the world of physics if you deny that consciousness has an effect on the physical universe  Nowhere is that more important than with our bodies  We cannot accept the placebo without accepting that the placebo is actually in effect 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, and that more than anything, our expectations and outlooks for our current and future state of health are what drives the wellness or sickness of our being
In order to complement my scientific understanding of what is happening between our mind and body, I have studied the mind through psychotherapy, hypnotherapy, NLP, the teachings of Buddhism, and I have trained to teach Yoga and meditation  This workshop is not only about sharing the framework of the new health paradigm coming from science, but to help with the understanding of what we can do to change the beliefs and paradigms we hold in our unconscious  Yoga is not simply a tool to maintain the fitness of the body, as is commonly believed in our western world, but it is a tool to help with mental stress and the creation of positivism  So many of us are stuck in habitual negative mental thought patterns, but there are so many ways to overcome this and take control of our own happiness  Happiness is something that comes from within, from our paradigms and beliefs about the world, and in actuality has nothing to do with outside circumstances, but to the way we react to those circumstances  Through this workshop I try to empower people with not only a framework of knowledge but with some basic tools like visualization meditations to help create this positive state of health  Even at the National Institute of Health, the medical 'old boys' institution in Washington DC, research is coming out weekly to show that we have the power to very specifically up-regulate hormone production or immune response in our bodies through visualization techniques, meditation, and specific yogic asanas 
For the last 2 years, I have been travelling through Australia  I am about to be purchasing a few hundred acres of land in the north okanagan with some friends to start a sustainable farming project with a permaculture and yoga school  Most of Australia, was actually about courses and wwoofing, but I was inspired by the festival scene there  I was enjoying festivals, but felt a desire to give back a little more to the experience  Some friends convinced me I should start hosting workshops, and over the past 2 years I have done over 20 workshops and the workshop has evolved with every experience
I have learned that the most effective way to share this understanding is to lead the workshop as a guided group discussion  I have the framework, the knowledge, and the depth of examples and experiences to share that I could speak for hours in front of a group, but with something so sensitive that every one of us has so much personal experience and perspective on, Ive found that encouraging as much discussion and sharing from the group is a far more effective way to get the point across  That being said, Ive learned several techniques which have helped me maintain order in a discussion that can bring up so many emotions
At the moment I am very busy starting a community futures small business program to help me avoid any mistakes with this big project, and searching for property  I am however happy to answer any questions you might have  I still dont have a website, although a friend is helping me slowly build one, and there is no formal presentation or powerpoint I can send you  
If you have a projector, it would help me get a few points across with short videos I have on my computer, but those are not necessary either  At the festivals in Australia, I was generally given an hour and half or two hours, although I spoke to several communities where the discussion  reached almost four hours  2 hours is more than enough though  Ive done the workshop on beaches, under festival tents, and in large rooms, so the location doesn't really matter, what matters most is the intimacy and a space where we can be uninterrupted for the time of the workshop  
I understand that this letter is coming a bit late, but there is no problem for me to join you guys if you have a bit of space you want filled up  The subject of the workshop is unique and has always excited people, and the main purpose I have in sharing is to empower people to understand the mind body connection so that they can live a healthy life  It has been 4 years since the last time I was sick, and this is something I am hoping to help others realize is possible
Thanks, and Im looking forward to hearing back from you
Chris Pisesky

bio:
I am a horse based educator who runs a practice out in Squamish Valley called Mountain Horse School I offer riding lessons, special needs sessions, workshops and one on-one-coaching that integrate the learning and transformation that becomes possible when we come into relationship with horses Horses are an embodiment of grounded power and mindfulness By working with them consciously, we drop into the realm of myth and ceremony- activating intuition, authenticity, true leadership, and heart/brain coherence 

Over the years I've taken some of the concepts I've learned through the work with the horses and transmuted them into other offerings that can happen without the presence of the animals themselves One such offering is called 'Dreamride', a 15 hr somatic ceremony/workshop where participants explore Mary Oliver's famous question: "Tell me, what it is you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?"

Dreamride is about dreaming and stalking our right wild lives; the ones where we can offer ourselves and our gifts as food to the world It harnesses the power and transformative potential of horse energy as we will ask for a herd of horses to carry us through a guided shamanic and somatic journey where we will ask for our dream to be revealed to us, and ask for a trail for us to follow to make it real in the world

Luminosity Flow: A Journey Through the Body

Short description: 
Punctuate your festival by stretching sore dancing muscles and re-centering the mindThis class will engage the entire body, combining aspects of energetic vinyasa flow, relaxing yin yoga, breathing practice and meditation Practice self-care Experience the outrageously beautiful transient NOW: breathe, dance, flow 
 
Full description: This workshop is based on a series that I have developed while working with a variety of bodies over the past 4 years: the Luminosity Flow The name reflects the brightness we all have within us, and the ways in which festival culture creates a space in which we feel empowered to shine and share the gift of our own unique self with the world around us It is my intention that this flow will help your body feel bright, balanced and ready to play 
Weï¿½ï¿½ll begin with pranayama breathing practice to create a space of grounded awareness and full breath From there we'll build to a powerful vinyasa flow, engaging muscular strength and willpower to create heat and energy in the body, After a powerful and dynamic peak, the flow will gradually melt into a floor series, in which we'll practice yin restorative yoga - deep stretching that gets into the fascia and connective tissue of the body Weï¿½ï¿½ll engage and stretch from root to crown, from skin to spine, leaving no stone unturned Closing with a juicy body-awareness meditation, this class is designed to provide a space for self-care so that you can get the most out of your festival experience 
Enjoy the privilege of your ALIVENESS 
Explore the conjunction of space, matter, gravity, body, light, language, consciousness 
Experience present-ness Be in your body: breathe, dance, flow 

Teacher Bio: 
Lauren DeGaine
I recieved my BA degree in Yoga Teacher Training from Naropa University Led by Nataraja Kallio, it is the only undergraduate degree program in yoga in the United States The 3-year training explored anatomy, theory, philosophy, history and origins, physiology, therapeutics, the chakras and more My teaching philosophy revolves around well-being: yoga works with the body, but engages the mind and the emotions as well Yoga asks how can we use our practice to engage with the world as our most authentic self 

Often using the chakra system as a lens, my classes emphasize resetting the nervous system, developing body awareness, balancing the masculine and feminine energies and working towards a sustained experience of well-being Yoga is exercise, but it can also be a process which gradually transmutes discordant energies in the body toward a state of joy and heightened awareness

This winter I have had the privilege of debuting a handcrafted class, Sexy Restorative Flow, at Amethyst Dance and Fitness studio in Victoria, BC The inspiration from this class came from a desire to combine exercise with restoration, and to indulge my love of deep, sexy bass music This class gave me the opportunity to formulate and share the Luminosity Flow and the Warrior Goddess Flow Iï¿½ï¿½m excited to bring these sequences to festivals this summer

Honest Non Monogamy 101: a 1 1/2 hr workshop

Open relationships? Polyamory? Relationship Anarchy? For many people, ethical and honest non monogamy is about freedom: freedom to love who you want, when you want, in whatever way feels authentic between adults and is mutually consensual It has a rosy reputation for being about not putting limitations on whom or how you love, being able to acknowledge your needs and desires and dreams, knowing that to expect one person alone to fulfill all of them is way too much pressure 

But what's the reality? How do the myths differ from the practical applications? How does it actually work in real life? Is non monogamy some enlightened approach to living, or simply another set of options for relating to other humans? Is there a Golden Path to polyamorous perfection, or is it a multilinear dance where we each get to decide what works for us as individuals? 

Whether honest non-monogamy is new to you, or you have years of experience, this workshop promises to offer fresh and insightful perspectives, and empower you with new tools to assist you in enjoying more fulfilling relationships!

Greetings! 

My practice comes in the form of a device called a Pineal Activation Light The Light uses an array of LED lights, which are set to strobe at frequencies which correlate with powerful healing, and meditative states It does so by stimulating the pineal gland, causing a release of endogenous tryptamines, which in turn, bring uses into states similar to those experienced with entheogens They are used primarily in healing centers, float houses, yoga schools, and therapeutic practices, but I have managed to successfully implement the light at various festivals/events, with a fully portable set up The light is a unique representation of spirit, and technology, much like the festivals I have attending with it 

To run my practice, I will set up a space in which participants -- individuals and small groups -- would be able to relax an ground themselves, and experience the effects of the light This would be done in a quiet spot, amidst other healers, or nestled away in a quiet patch of art If I am able to manage the logistics of transporting an 8x8 copper pyramid frame, it shall be set up under that

As I have to operate the device, will be guiding participants through the whole experience, answering questions, setting the tone, providing music via noise canceling headphones, and burning all sorts of delicious smelling items This space shall be held for a few hours a day, toward dusk, when the light is most effective

I would be honored to be a part of this gathering, and am looking forward to hearing back from you!

Blessings to you!

Joshua

Greetings!  This an updated version of the talk I gave last year at Blessed Coast, this time with a year's experience in the new story of love and actionable principles for conscious relating for festival goers   This workshop has been successfully delivered at Rainbow Serpent & Earth Frequency Australia, and Envision Costa Rica   

HEALING OF LOVE: Sex, Partnership and the Village
Duration: 90 minutes
Tech requirements: none

Many are beginning to question the current story of love: the belief that we must find "THE ONE": a partner who will grant our happiness and fulfill all our needs And yet, with growing divorce rates, betrayal, and stressed partnerships, the old story isn't working for many Others are experimenting with various models of open relationship and alternative forms - some finding joy but also much heartache 

New paradigm filmmaker Ian MacKenzie and co-facilitator Mya Hardman aka AppleCat speak about the research from Tamera peace village in Portugal, exploring the foundations the new story in love and sexuality How might we cultivate communities of trust to support the freedom to love without fear? 

Whatever your relationship form, monogamy, polyamory or beyond, this workshop will explore the role of the community in healthy partnership

"The Spiral Dance: a Wiccan Celebration of Life and Community"

The Spiral, an ancient symbol connecting our present day with our ancient spiritual roots: a
continuum that signifies the movement of energy It is this mind set of positive energy to
promote positive results that is danced into our existence
With the help of the help of the Goddess, and the powers of nature we weave our magick into action to support healing of our Great Mother Earth
Through the Spiral Dance we are provided the opportunity to connect to one another, and along with the momentum of the dance, we are propelled slowly inward, toward reflection,  turning to express and expand outward only when we have turned that small corner in the centre The Spiral Dance is conducted as a significant portion of a basic Wiccan Circle where the stated intention is to bring healing and respect to our relationship with Nature and the Earth, and to share in a celebration of community This involves the creation of the circle, the calling and establishment of the 4 quarters, elements, and directions, the statement of intention, the raising of energy through the spiral dance, chanting and drumming, the blessing, and the conclusion

Time speaks to us through our bodies and our observation of the natural world Our fascination with documenting our story has lead to intricate calendars and time keeping practices Cultures around the globe in many different eras have charted, logged and documented time in diverse ways to mark our celebration times and honor what is of value to the culture Our current mainstream culture can be observed as monotone within its linear time scape with little to no nuances reflecting our varied seasonal experience or giving rise to the eternal   This system does not honor our true cyclical nature or give permission to our capacity to respond to observation This workshop will give insight into a few different time keeping practices that have been documented, with a glance into Lunarsolar calendars that give credence to both of our most present cosmic bodies/ symbolic time keepers in the sky, Sun and moon  We will also look into how all of the zodiac signs reflect the time of year that they are placed in, showing the first astrologers used there observation of the natural environment around and within them to make sense of what was going on within and without We will look at how a functioning Lunarsolar calendar can work today based on the sun and moon and zodiac signs in dynamic harmony As we explore our connection to our environment, we will dive into some exercises that invite us to explore our own capacity for observation We are the present moment, the newness of this time is experienced through our faculties of perception, we are sacred timekeepers What is the cosmos/ natural world communicating with us, through our senses? Can we tap into the natural world to reveal the mysteries of light and the shadow, what is at play? Can we hear the moments that invite us to pause long enough to catch the next wave? Can we harmonize with our surroundings?  If we are in tune with our environment, the planet, astral bodies, and our being can we empower ourselves through harmony to create a paradigm that supports and honors life?  We will reflect upon our harmony and balance within our ecosystem, as possible pathways for greater inner peace  Many of us are already living in a closer connection to the rhythmic nature of the natural world This workshop will give language to and empower our capacity for healthy shifts by being that which is true to our hearts  As the workshop draws to a close an assignment will be designated to participants to adventure into the natural environment and have a conversation with there surroundings, tools, tips and guidance will be offered for this exercise The exercise is a medium for raising our capacity to have a thriving relationship with the natural world and developing our capacity to harmonize and create from this place of connection Time is not a force we must work against rather a reflection that can serve us in harmonizing our intentions and actions with the great cosmic symphony of existence

Title of workshop:
"Sustainability for millennial's"

Introduction: 
This is about a 30-45 minute group workshop that will help to inform and educate our current generation on how to design anything in a sustainable frame of mind Weather it be physical products, art, music, fashion, or even if you want to make your daily life more sustainable, this is the catalyst to get the natural reaction going!

Outline: There will be a short introduction of myself and background, followed by a group exercise involving participants and getting them thinking in the right state of mind! We will then dive into the main focus of the workshop, 2 case studies The first is a look at the declining industry of physical print design vs against the ever growing digital graphic design industry This will lay out what some people already know about sustainability, which is the environmental part But in the next case study, the story of a sustainable restaurant in Vancouver BC that is striving to stay above water in tough times while battling against the corporate chains that just feed on profits This topic will help to grow everyones understanding of what it means to be "sustainable", over catch phrases like "going green, or being environmental/social conscious" This will cover most of the lecture, if there are not too many questions throughout this period and time is going well, another case study or example will be presented to further expand upon the subject From there we will participate in a second group exercise where we come up with ideas in small groups of products of ideas we can make more sustainable using the information we just learned There will be a short conclusion and information given on where to find out more, and time for final questions at the end


Some of the key notes addressed will be:
-The definition of sustainability, ï¿½ï¿½Meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needsï¿½ï¿½
-The three pillars of sustainability: enivronmentally sound economically viable, and socially just
-The principles of sustainable design: learning from natural systems, respect for energy/resources, respect for people, respect for place, respect for future, and systems thinking
-practical steps designers can take to make a difference: design for use, dematerialization, design for disassembly, substution, localization, transmaterialization, design for durability, design for reuse unintended & intended, and redesigning the system 
-Setting up sustainable framework, ie: LCAlife cycle assessment, The Green table Network, Oceanwise certification, making your own DIY

A little about myself: I am a Sustainable Graphic Designer that grew up in Vancouver, BC I Studied at the vancouver art institute and graduated with a Bachelors of applied design, minoring in sustainability I have been working freelance for the last year and a bit now, and before that I worked in a firm and some corprate positions

My areas of expertise are in the pranic/subtle bodies, the nuances of the psyche, the freedom of the physical body, the integration of multi-disciplinary teachings, the trust and holding within conscious communication, the living essence of spirituality plus a whole lot of simple earthy, muddy-messy fun! ; 

I've included a list of potential offerings below 
I'm open to guiding as many classes as would be of service 

ENERGIZING YOGA 

shakti sadhana

A meditation + flow devoted to a sacred goddess, channelling specific mantras, visualizations, and qualities that each goddess embodies Each class would invite in a new goddess as an aspect of sacred Shakti essence and speak directly to her teachings 

chakra awakening

A meditation + flow devoted to our wheels of light, with inquiry on specific demons of the chakra or set of chakras, followed by intentional chakra-balancing practices to move through blockages 

elemental experience 

A meditation + flow devoted to the elements of the sacred Mother, calling in the ancient teachings of Earth, Air, Fire and Water Through sacred song, toning and elemental movement, we connect with nature in full presence 

***

WORKSHOPS

sacred rebirthing | breathwork

3 hours, if possible A medicinal breathwork experience incorporating elements of osho meditation, circular breath, shamanic drumming, and five rhythms Very potent for healing the energetic/ emotional bodies, deep grief, and any body of suffering 

white tantra | meditation

A powerful healing experience incorporating the masculine/ feminine energies in a practice of sacred seeing An open, compassionate and safe way of exploring spiritual expansion through tantric practices Awakens a deeper realm of self-love, and love for the beloved other 

shake baby shake | movement 

A liberating, all-feelings-welcome experience of shaking, chanting, screaming, dancing, howling, feeling all the feelings and shaking off the stagnancy An expansive space for the feminine power of healing ï¿½ï¿½ through song, dance, emoting, tribe, love

chant your heart out | music + movement

 A wildly joyful, song-based experience to activate Vishuddha A mix of mantras, rainbow songs, and vocal toning paired to kundalini-inspired movement Perfect for energizing, connecting, and feeling happy happy happy 

***

HEALING YOGA 

journeying within 

A blend of yin yoga + sound healing with the voices of crystal bowls, koshi chimes, sansula and shruti Perfect for meditation and introspection, integrating the teachings of an intense and powerful day 

sweet dreams

A relaxing sound healing experience in a simple shavasana or earthy restorative pose Sacred instruments used to drum or sing in gentle and nourishing ways, preparing for a deep and restful sleep 

***

OTHER OFFERINGS

ï¿½ï¿½ the possibilities are limitless!

For me, dance is a true expression of our souls and also showing us our physical and mental blockages The way we move and are moved by Life is showing us a clear mirror of ourselves and can deeply contribute to our evolution  In this always accelerating world we are living in, dance is a powerful tool to clear the mind and come back to our senses Offering a dance floor where we can get out of the box, re-connect with our body/spirit and transcend the fears is one of the purpose of my offerings  In doing so, we are opening ourselves to the divine/sensual aspect of ourselves and taping in our healing power By creating a balance between guidance and free dancing, we enter in a sacred space where we can receive, share and grow

The Sacred Sharing Circle is a transformational process, in which participants are guided to share within a safe and open space their current external/internal challenges that are arising in life and/or within the festival experience in order to open up and receive the gifts/teachings which life itself are providing us with

In the end participants not only have the opportunity to strengthen their connection with and learn from one another, but also have a chance to re-connect with the teachings of the Medicine wheel and become better equipped to carry with them this practical tool of the sharing circle which, can then be utilized in our own communities and homes in order to assist with our ability to honour our relationships with ourselves, others and all that exists and transform our lives

"As a couple we have seen first hand within our own relationship, and with our two boys the importance and value of the sharing circle - which is the main reason why we travel the country sharing this tool within homes and schools  Recognizing it may be the most essential tool for us to utilize in order to re-connect with one another by creating the space to openly communicate our emotions in a safe, respectful way  Allowing us to gain a mutual understanding for one another while being able to practice the essential skills of expressing our emotions, being present/able to listen to one another, and recognize that we do in fact have the ability to process anything and everything we face in life - especially when we are able to do it together"

Dear Blessed Coast,
I would love the opportunity to offer poi spinning workshops at your festival! For anyone that doesn't know, poi spinning can be considered a circus flow art and involves spinning weighted balls on the end of strings, usually one in each hand Poi spinning originated as a Maori tradition to improve warriors wrist/arm flexibility and dexterity, and has now developed into a performance art, with fire performance and urban street circus being two major forms
I have personally been spinning poi for two years now, having performed with both fire and LED poi at various events, including the Whistler Blackcomb Fire and Ice shows I have also spent many hours teaching poi to various people including friends and more formal arrangements I can offer instruction right from complete beginner moves up to advanced techniques, performance considerations and improving general flow In terms of workshops I am happy to offer multiple workshops at different standards or just adapt to the class based on demand
I am an avid yoga enthusiast and mostly follow the Ashtanga practice although I have enjoyed many Iyengar and Hatha classes I would love the opportunity to be a part of and contribute to this event as I feel that is the best way to experience festivals
I hope you can consider my application, I look forward to hearing back from you!
Peace, love and my warmest regards,
Samuel Scott

comments:
When I discovered hot yoga 3 years ago, I was struggling with a lot of mental and physical health issues (anxiety, lack of sleep...etc.) Since I started practicing, I am addicted to the benefits yoga has to offer, and one of the great things about yoga is how everyone's practice is unique and does it for different reasons, but when people practice together in class, it builds a community of support, acceptance, and unity. 

Currently I practice yoga at Moksha in Squamish, BC. My friend works there, and I love the community at the studio. I would love to volunteer with the yoga team at Blessed Coast, as a thank you to the yoga practice in general, all of my instructors, fellow yogis for helping me overcome many battles. I would love to learn from amazing yogis about their stories, and help bring a similar sense of supportive community that I feel at Moksha in Squamish. I also am new to Squamish and want to help out and get to know the community more!

I am also passionate about the local community. One of the amazing things about Squamish is the connections and support that exists within this town. Local food, music, businesses don't seem to battle but do everything they can to support one another, which makes Squamish such an amazing place to live. Blessed Coast seems to have a similar objective in helping local community organizations and people connect with one another to create opportunities for growth, connectivity, and improvement of overall health.

I am passionate about what Blessed Coast strives to do and would love the opportunity to help in any way with this event. 

Thank you for reading through my application, and I hope to connect!

Carrie

I recently underwent a huge surgery on my leg and itï¿½s left me rather stagnant during recovery..coming into my body and having to re learn my practises all over again. A slow, yet beautiful process.

comments:
Ooooh. 
Well, I feel like I spilled a lot of my enthusiasm into the skills section.
So I will take this section to explain myself and why to volunteer!
I am supremely energetic. Very focused on presence. Connection. Love. Truth. Community. Sharing and GIVING. I feel abundant. I am at a very stable and powerful place in my life, and am in touch with the well of infinite potential within. I wish to give it to this festival, for the sake of growth and humanity. 
I am Here to be Here. Looking forward to what we can cocreate, with a group of conscious individuals sharing a dream of Magic.

Kids Zone!

1 Year as a PreSchool Teacher, Cambodia 2014
3 Day Certified Rainbow Yoga Teacher for Children
Currently enrolled in ECE Program to begin in Terrace, BC in September
Currently employed with Stewardship Pemberton as an Outdoor Nature Educator for Children at the One Mile Lake Nature Center

Living Local and currently diving deep into my passion for teaching, learning, and being with children! Seeing this as a great opportunity :)

Cooking
Also quite interested and passionate about this. Cooking for many years in Ski Lodges, Fire Camps, Restaurants, Friends Homes, Camp Fires, Myself and Loved ones...
Focusing a lot on Whole Foods, mostly Plant Based, gourmet and decadent, indulgent and healthy... All the good things.
If no Kids Zone available, am very open to helping with this.

If both Kids and Food unavailable, would be willing do something... Quite keen in general to being part of this beautiful gathering that has been recommended by some glorious Souls in my life. Gavin Deyoung (Whom I believe to be performing) and a friend Kaya, from Paradise Valley, Squamish, who encouraged me to do this <3

Thank you for taking time to read this, much appreciated.
